medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The pain began at the beginning of an unspecified time frame and has been episodic, with the most recent episode starting three days ago. The patient describes the pain as sharp, constant, and located in the mid-epigastric region, radiating to the right upper quadrant (RUQ) and occasionally to the back. Associated symptoms include non-bloody vomiting and nausea. The patient has experienced multiple episodes of this pain and has visited the hospital approximately four times over the past month, receiving pain medications each time.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Hepatitis C diagnosed in an unspecified year, chronic leg pain following an accident, and previous appendectomy.
